see through.translation[0].definitions[0: to realize that someone is trying to deceive you
I could never lie to her because I know she’d see through me straight away.
I can’t bluff – she’d see right through me.
see through.translation[0].definitions[1: to continue doing something until it is finished, especially something difficult or unpleasant
It’ll take a lot of effort to see the project through.
see through.translation[0].definitions[2: to give help and support to someone during a difficult time
Setting goals should help see you through.
I’ve got enough money to see me through six months of unemployment.
see through.translation[0].definitions[3: to see something or think about it in the way that someone else does
The world is very different when seen through the eyes of a child.
see through.translation[1].definitions[0: a see-through material or surface allows you to see through it
